[[File:Kenny Anthony, Sta. Lucía.jpg|thumb|180px|Dr Kenny Anthony, Prime Minister of St Lucia]] [[File:DARREN SAMMY.jpg|thumb|180px|Darren Sammy, International cricketer]] This is a '''list of people from Saint Lucia''' in the eastern Caribbean.
==A== * [[Makeba Alcide]] (born 1990) - athlete, born in Castries<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.athletebio.com/lca1990f1|title = Makeba Alcide|accessdate = 2012-05-20}}</ref> * [[Pamela Alfred]] (born 1978) - international cricketer<ref>{{cite web| url = http://www.espncricinfo.com/westindies/content/player/55181.html| title = Pamela Alfred|accessdate = 2012-05-20}}</ref> * [[Kenny Anthony|Kenny Davis Anthony]] (born 1951) - Prime Minister of St Lucia, born in Laborie * [[Joyce Auguste]] - musician and leader of [[The Hewanorra Voices]] * [[Marie Grace Augustin]] (1897–1996) - businesswoman<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.stlucianewsonline.com/did-you-know-marie-grace-augustin-and-ives-heraldine-rock/|title= DID YOU KNOW: Marie Grace Augustin and Ives Heraldine Rock|publisher= St Lucia News|accessdate = 25 April 2014}}</ref>
==B== * [[Michelle Baptiste]] (born 1977) - Olympic long jumper, born in St Lucia * [[Danielle Beaubrun]] (born 1990) - Olympic swimmer, born in St Lucia<ref>{{cite web| url = http://www.fgcuathletics.com/swimdive/roster-print/2011-12/2467/danielle-beaubrun/| title = Danielle Beaubrun| accessdate = 2012-05-20| deadurl = yes| archiveurl = https://archive.is/20120731020742/http://www.fgcuathletics.com/swimdive/roster-print/2011-12/2467/danielle-beaubrun/| archivedate = 2012-07-31| df = }}</ref> *[[Kevin Bertin]] also known as Monét X Change (born 1990) - drag queen and [[RuPaul's Drag Race (season 10)|RuPaul's Drag Race Season 10]] contestant, born in St Lucia * [[Rufus Bousquet|Rufus George Bousquet]] (born 1958) - politician, cabinet minister, born in St Lucia
==C== * [[Ignatius Cadette]] (born 1957) - international cricketer, born in Castries<ref>{{cite web | url= http://www.espncricinfo.com/westindies/content/player/51499.html| title = Ignatius Cadette|accessdate = 2012-05-20}}</ref> * [[Neville Cenac]] - Foreign Minister of St Lucia, born in Soufriere * [[Winston Cenac|Winston Francis Cenac]] (1925–2004) - Prime Minister of St Lucia, born in Soufriere * [[George Charles|George Frederick Lawrence Charles]] (1916–2004) - Chief Minister of St Lucia * [[Johnson Charles]] (born 1989) - International cricketer, born in Castries<ref>{{cite web| url = http://www.espncricinfo.com/westindies/content/player/333066.html| title = Johnson Charles|accessdate = 2013-02-24}}</ref> * Ryan Charles (born 1986) - St Lucian, British based boxer, mother born in St Lucia<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.enfieldindependent.co.uk/sport/9584098.Edmonton_boxer_chases_Olympic_place/|title= Edmonton boxer chases London Olympics place|accessdate = 25 August 2013}}</ref> * [[Frederick Clarke (governor)|Sir Frederick Joseph Clarke]] (1912–1980) - St Lucia’s first native governor (1967–1973)<ref>{{cite web| url = http://governorgeneral.govt.lc/FrederickClarke| title = Frederick Clarke|accessdate = 2014-07-05}}</ref> * [[John Compton|Sir John George Melvin Compton]] (1925–2007) - Chief Minister of St Lucia, born St Vincent and the Grenadines but raised in St Lucia * [[Petrus Compton]] - politician and government minister
==D== *[[Stephen Dantes]] (born 1982) - poet and novelist, born in Saltibus, Choiseul<ref>{{cite web | url = http://stephendantes.net| title = Stephen A. Dantes|accessdate = 2013-03-31}}</ref> *[[Suzie d'Auvergne|Suzie Agnes-Ida d'Auvergne]] (1942–2014) - High Court judge<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thevoiceslu.com/local_news/2014/august/19_08_14/DEATH.htm |title=DEATH OF A PIONEER - Justice Suzie d’Auvergne Dies At 71 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140826113927/http://www.thevoiceslu.com/local_news/2014/august/19_08_14/DEATH.htm |archivedate=2014-08-26 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> *[[Nicole David]] - soca musician * Sir [[Justin Louis Devaux]] (1884–1943) - lawyer and colonial Chief Justice<ref> {{cite web|url= http://www.seychellesweekly.com/November%2013,%202011/top5_seychelles_chief_justice.html|title= Seychelles Chief Justice and the First Coup d’état. |publisher= Seychelles e-news|accessdate = 7 October 2015}} </ref>
==E== * [[Darvin Edwards]] (born 1986) - high jumper, St Lucian record holder, born in Castries<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.iamstlucian.com/inspiring-stlucians.html |title=inspiring St Lucians |accessdate=2012-05-20 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120715005018/http://www.iamstlucian.com/inspiring-stlucians.html |archivedate=2012-07-15 |df= }}</ref> * [[Craig Emmanuel|Craig Walt Emmanuel]] (born 1986) - international cricketer, born in St Lucia<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.espncricinfo.com/westindies/content/player/51787.html| title = Craig Emmanuel|accessdate = 2012-05-20}}</ref> * [[Edmund Estephane]] (born 1968) - politician, cabinet minister<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uwpstlucia.com/the-uwp/54/edmund-estephane |title=Edmund Estephane - Dennery South |accessdate=2012-05-20 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120104071204/http://uwpstlucia.com/the-uwp/54/edmund-estephane |archivedate=2012-01-04 |df= }}</ref> * [[Erma-Gene Evans]] (born 1984) - javelin thrower, born in Castries<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/ev/erma-gene-evans-1.html |title=Erma-Gene Evans Biography |publisher=SR/Olympicsports |accessdate=2012-05-20 |deadurl=bot: unknown |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161203041227/http://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/ev/erma-gene-evans-1.html |archivedate=2016-12-03 |df= }}</ref>
==F== * [[Verena Felician|Verena Marcelle Felicien]] (born 1964) - women's Test cricketer, born in Castries<ref>{{cite web| url = http://www.espncricinfo.com/westindies/content/player/55126.html|title = Verena Felicien|accessdate = 2013-02-24}}</ref> * [[Alvin La Feuille]] (born 1978) - international cricketer<ref>{{cite web| url = http://www.espncricinfo.com/westindies/content/player/52335.html|title = Alvin La Feuille| accessdate = 2013-02-24}}</ref> * [[Felix Finisterre]] - politician * [[Vincent Floissac|Sir Vincent Floissac]] (1928–2010) - lawyer and judge, born in St Lucia * [[Sarah Flood-Beaubrun|Sarah Lucy Flood-Beaubrun]] (born 1969) - politician and government minister,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stlucia.gov.lc/govfolks/hon_sarah_lucy_flood_beaubrun.htm |title=Hon. Sarah Lucy Flood-Beaubrun |accessdate=2012-05-20 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111010185623/http://stlucia.gov.lc/govfolks/hon_sarah_lucy_flood_beaubrun.htm |archivedate=2011-10-10 |df= }}</ref> born in Desruisseaux * [[Emile Ford]] (born Michael Emile Telford Miller) (born 1937) - singer and musician (Emile Ford and the Checkmates), born in Castries, raised in the Bahamas<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.45-rpm.org.uk/dire/emilef.htm| title= Emile Ford And The Checkmates|accessdate = 16 December 2013}} (gives incorrect birth name)</ref> * [[Hunter J. Francois]] (1924–2014) - politician and government minister<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.htsstlucia.org/HTS_News/2014/November/17/PM-pays-tribute-to-the-late-Hunter-Francois.html#.VGtMOslNfUt |title=PM pays tribute to the late Hunter François |accessdate=2014-11-18 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141120224427/http://htsstlucia.org/HTS_News/2014/November/17/PM-pays-tribute-to-the-late-Hunter-Francois.html#.VGtMOslNfUt |archivedate=2014-11-20 |df= }}</ref> * [[Walter Francois]] - politician * [[Richard Frederick]] (born 1965) - lawyer, politician and government minister, born in Micoud<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uwpstlucia.com/the-uwp/31/richard-frederick |title=Richard Frederick- Castries Central |accessdate=2012-05-20 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120104070240/http://uwpstlucia.com/the-uwp/31/richard-frederick |archivedate=2012-01-04 |df= }}</ref>
==G== * [[Louis George (politician)|Louis Bertrand George]] - politician and government minister<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.stlucianewsonline.com/breaking-news-former-education-minister-dies/ |title=Former education minister dies |accessdate=2014-01-04}}</ref>
==H== * [[Cornelius Henry|Cornelius Cyprian Henry]] (born 1956) - international cricketer (for Canada), born in St Lucia<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.cricketworld4u.com/canada/profile/cornelius-henry.php| title = Cornelius Henry- Profile|accessdate = 2012-05-20}}</ref> * [[Ronald "Boo" Hinkson]] - jazz guitarist, born in St Lucia<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.cdbaby.com/Artist/RonaldBooHinkson| title = Ronald Boo Hinkson - Biography|accessdate = 2012-08-01}}</ref> * [[Emma Hippolyte]] - OBE, politician * [[Kendel Hippolyte]] - poet and playwright, born in St Lucia<ref>{{cite web| url = http://www.jrank.org/literature/pages/4407/Kendel-Hippolyte.html| title= Kendel Hippolyte Biography|accessdate = 3 October 2013}}</ref> * [[Julian Hunte|Julian Robert Hunte]] (born 1940) - politician, foreign minister, born in Castries<ref>{{cite web| url = http://www.espncricinfo.com/westindies/content/player/304501.html| title = Julian Hunte| accessdate = 2012-05-21}}</ref>
==J== * [[Shervon Jack]] (born 1986) - professional footballer<ref>{{cite web| url = http://www.caribbeanfootballdatabase.com/saintlucia/players/shervonjack.html| title = Shervon Jack - Player| accessdate = 2012-05-20}}</ref> * [[Arsene James|Arsene Vigil James]] (1944) - politician, born in Desruisseaux<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stlucia.gov.lc/govfolks/hon_arsene_vigil_james.htm |title=Honourable Arsene Vigil James |accessdate=2012-05-20 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111010193856/http://stlucia.gov.lc/govfolks/hon_arsene_vigil_james.htm |archivedate=2011-10-10 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uwpstlucia.com/the-uwp/42/arsene-james |title=The UWP- Arsene James , Micoud South |accessdate=1 June 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120104070918/http://uwpstlucia.com/the-uwp/42/arsene-james |archivedate=4 January 2012 |df= }}</ref> * [[Earl Jean|Earl Jude Jean]] (born 1971) - professional footballer, St Lucian international, born in St Lucia * [[Ignatius Jean]] - politician * [[Velon John|Velon Leo John]] - politician * [[Sonia M. Johnny]] (born 1953) - permanent member of the Permanent Council of the Organization of American States, first woman ambassador to the United States * [[Dominic Johnson|Dominic Laurence Johnson]] - Olympic athlete, multiple St Lucian record holder<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/jo/dominic-johnson-1.html|title = Dominic Johnson - Biography|accessdate = 2012-05-20}}</ref> * [[Ezechiel Joseph]] - politician * [[Guy Joseph]] - politician * [[Zepherinus Joseph]] (born 1975) - middle and long distance runner, St Lucian multiple record holder, born in Mon Repos<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/jo/zepherinus-joseph-1.html|title = Zepherinus Joseph - Biography|accessdate = 2012-05-20}}</ref> * [[Peter Josie]] - former politician, born in Vieux Fort * [[Didacus Jules]] (born c.1957) - educator<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.northerncaribbeanconference.com/dr-didacus-jules |title=Dr Didacus Jules, PhD, EMBA, MSc, BA, Registrar & Chief Executive Officer, Caribbean Examinations Council |accessdate=2012-05-20 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101222065946/http://www.northerncaribbeanconference.com/dr-didacus-jules |archivedate=2010-12-22 |df= }}</ref>
==K== * [[Jane King (poet)|Jane King]] (born 1952) - poet, born in Castries<ref>{{cite web| url = http://www.spaceswords.com/?page_id=101| title = Jane King|accessdate = 2012-05-20}}</ref> * [[Stephenson King]] (born 1958) - Prime Minister of St Lucia, born in Castries
==L== * [[Cyprian Lansiquot]] - lawyer and politician * [[Cecil Lay]] - politician * [[Vernetta Lesforis]] (born 1975) - Olympic sprinter, born in St Lucia * [[Alderman Lesmond|Alderman Rowe Nicholas Lesmond]] (born 1978) - international cricketer, born in St Lucia<ref>{{cite web| url = http://www.espncricinfo.com/westindies/content/player/220839.html| title = Alderman Lesmond| accessdate = 2012-05-20}}</ref> * [[Allen Montgomery Lewis]] (1909–1993) - Governor-General of St Lucia, born in Castries<ref> {{cite web|url=http://www.eccourts.org/brief-history-of-the-court/sir-allen-montgomery-lewis/|title= Sir Allen Montgomery Lewis|accessdate = 17 September 2015}} </ref> * [[Vaughan Lewis|Vaughan Allen Lewis]] (born 1940) - Prime Minister of St Lucia<ref>{{cite web |url = http://sta.uwi.edu/iir/news/today/2005_02.pdf|title= Professor Vaughan Allen Lewis|accessdate = 2012-05-20}}</ref> * [[Arthur Lewis (economist)|Sir William Arthur Lewis]] (1915–1991) - economist, Nobel Prize for Economics in 1979, born in Castries * [[Allan Louisy|Sir Allan Fitzgerald Laurent Louisy]] (1916–2011) - Prime Minister of St Lucia, born in Labourie * [[Pearlette Louisy|Dame Pearlette Louisy]] (born 1946) - Governor General of St Lucia, born in Laborie
==M== * [[George Mallet|William George Mallet]] (1923–2010) - Deputy Prime Minister, Governor-General, born Panama and raised in St Lucia<ref>{{cite web|url=http://stluciastar.com/george-mallet-passes-on/ |title=Sir George Mallet passes on |publisher=St Lucia Star |accessdate=5 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222065417/http://stluciastar.com/george-mallet-passes-on/ |archivedate=22 February 2014 |df= }}</ref> * [[Joseph Marcell]] (born 1948) - actor (played the butler in ''Fresh Prince of Bel Air''), born in St Lucia but moved to England at nine years of age<ref>{{cite web | url= http://www.buddytv.com/info/joseph-marcell-info.aspx| title = Joseph Marcell Biography|accessdate = 2012-05-20}}</ref> * [[Mario Michel]] (born 1960) - lawyer, high court judge and politician, government minister<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eccourts.org/antigua_barbuda.html |title=Eastern Caribbean Supreme Court |accessdate=2012-05-21 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100818011958/http://www.eccourts.org/antigua_barbuda.html |archivedate=2010-08-18 |df= }}</ref> * [[Keith Mondesir]] (born 1948) - politician and government minister, born in Castries * [[Lenard Montoute|Peter Lenard Montoute]] (born 1962) - politician and government minister, born in Gros Islet<ref>{{cite web |url=http://archive.stlucia.gov.lc/govfolks/hon_lenard_spider_montoute.htm |title=Honourable Lenard Montoute |accessdate=8 November 2013}}</ref>
==N== * [[Marcus Nicholas|Marcus Neill Nicholas]] - politician
==O== * [[George Odlum]] (1934–2003) - Deputy Prime Minister of St Lucia, born in Castries
==P== * [[Jamie Peterkin]] (born 1982) - Olympic swimmer, born in Castries<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.ukathletics.com/sports/c-swim/mtt/peterkin_jamie00.html|title = Player bio: Jamie Peterkin|accessdate = 2012-05-20}}</ref> * [[Michael Pilgrim]] (born 1947) - Acting Prime Minister of St Lucia * [[Alain Providence]] (born 1976, 29 November) - football manager, ex St.Lucia national football team manager
==R == * [[Menissa Rambally]] (born 1976) - politician and government minister * [[Rene Regis]] (born 1973) - international footballer * [[Alvina Reynolds]] - politician and government Minister for Health, Wellness, Human Services and Gender Relations <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.voteslp.com/team/reynolds |title=Minister Alvina Reynolds |accessdate=16 September 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151128073531/http://www.voteslp.com/team/reynolds |archivedate=28 November 2015 |df= }}</ref> * [[Gale Rigobert|Gale Tracy Christiane Rigobert]] - politician,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://archive.stlucia.gov.lc/govfolks/members_of_the_house_of_assembly.htm |title=Members of the House of Assembly |accessdate=30 October 2013}}</ref> born in Micoud<ref>{{cite web |url=http://uwpstlucia.com/the-uwp/43/dr-gale-t-c-rigobert |title=Dr. Gail Rigobert - United Workers Party |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120911113522/http://uwpstlucia.com/the-uwp/43/dr-gale-t-c-rigobert |archivedate=11 September 2012}}</ref> * [[Lennard Riviere]] - MP and Attorney-General, from Soufriere * [[Heraldine Rock|Ives Heraldine Rock]] (1933–2012) - politician and government minister<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.caribjournal.com/2012/09/04/st-lucia-mourns-heraldine-rock-countrys-first-female-parliamentarian/ |title=St Lucia Mourns Heraldine Rock, Country’s First Female Parliamentarian |accessdate=30 October 2013}}</ref>
==S== * [[Darren Sammy|Darren Julius Garvey Sammy]] (born 1983) - international test cricketer, born in Dugard, Micoud<ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.espncricinfo.com/westindies/content/player/53115.html| title = Darren Sammy|accessdate = 2012-05-20}}</ref> * [[Jonel Scott]] (born 1992) - played in ESPN Rise High School National Basketball Game 2011 <ref>http://wildcats.sunyit.edu/DSC_0026.jpg?max_height=200&max_width=200</ref> * [[Sesenne|Sesenne or Dame Marie Selipha Descartes]], DBE, BEM (1914-2010) - folk singer, born in Malgretoute, Micoud<ref>{{cite web |url = http://caribbeanreviewofbooks.com/crb-archive/23-september-2010/woodsmoke-and-ground-doves/| title = Woodsmoke and ground-doves|accessdate = 2012-08-01}}</ref> * [[Anthony Severin|Anthony Bryan Severin]] (born 1955) - Ambassador to the United Nations<ref>{{cite web | url = http://article.wn.com/view/2006/08/11/new_permanent_representative_of_saint_lucia_presents_credent/| title = NEW PERMANENT REPRESENTATIVE OF SAINT LUCIA PRESENTS CREDENTIALS | accessdate = 2012-05-21}}</ref> * [[Aimran Simmons]] - musician and pan player * [[Joseph Solomon]] (died 1995) - executed murderer * [[Shawn Son|Shawn Peter Son]] (born 1982) - music producer, born in Vieux Fort<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.amazon.com/King-Firepower-The-Reggaemalasound-Band/dp/B003GGQ676| title = Shawn Peter Son}}</ref> * [[Levern Spencer|Levern Donaline Spencer]] (born 1984) - high jumper, born in Castries<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/sp/lavern-spencer-1.html| title = Lavern Spencer biography|accessdate = 2012-05-20}}</ref> * [[Clement Springer]] - musician and folklorist
==T== * [[Philip Tisson|Isidore Philip Tisson]] (1985–2010) - international footballer, shot in New York<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.worldfootball.net/spieler_profil/philip-tisson/| title= Philip Tisson|publisher= Worldfootbal.nt|accessdate = 2012-05-21}}</ref>
==W== * [[Derek Alton Walcott]] (1930-2017) - poet and playwright, Nobel Prizewinner 1992, born in Castries<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/literature/laureates/1992/walcott-bio.html| title = Derek Walcott- Biography|publisher= Nobelprize.org|accessdate = 2012-05-20}}</ref> * [[Roderick Walcott]] (1930–2000) - dramatist, twin brother of Derek Alton Walcott, born in Castries * [[Rick Wayne]] (born Learie Carasco) (born 1938) - bodybuilder, publisher and talk-show host, born in St Lucia<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.ifbbpro.com/hall-of-fame-welcome-message/rick-wayne/| title = Rick Wayne|accessdate = 2012-05-20}}</ref> * [[Boswell Williams]] (born 1926) - politician, Governor General, born in St Lucia * [[Marius Wilson]] - politician * [[Patrick Wilson (boxer)|Patrick Wilson]] - cruiserweight boxer, "The Destroyer" * [[Trix Worrell]] (born 1960) - writer and director, born in St Lucia<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.screenonline.org.uk/people/id/559692/index.html| title = Worrell, Trix (1960-)|accessdate = 2012-05-20}}</ref>
==X== * [[Llewellyn Xavier]], OBE (born 1945) - artist, born in St Lucia<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.llewellynxavier.com/artist.html |title=Llewellyn Xavier |accessdate=2012-05-20 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120209130530/http://www.llewellynxavier.com/artist.html |archivedate=2012-02-09 |df= }}</ref>
==Y== * [[Marland Yarde]] - [[rugby union]] player who has played for the [[England national rugby union team|English]] national side, born in St Lucia
==References== {{reflist}}

{{expand list|date=May 2014}} {{Outdated as of|date=January 2017}} The following is a list of the world's deepest [[caves]] per documented maximum depth. The depth value is measured from the highest entrance to the lowest accessible point.
{| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Name ! Depth (m) ! Length (m) ! Country ! Geology ! Notes |-
| [[Veryovkina Cave]] | style="text-align:center;"| 2212<ref name="EVM2018">{{cite web | last = Lyubimov | first = Petr | language = Russian | title = Экспедиция в Верёвкина март 2018. Глубина пещеры достигла -2212 метров. | trans-title = Expedition to Veryovkina in March 2018. Cave depth reached -2212 m | date = 12 March 2018 | URL = http://incave.org/2024-2/ |access-date = 25 November 2018 }}</ref><!--{{Convert|0|m|ft|abbrev=on|sortable=on}} depth m--> | style="text-align:center;"|13,500<ref name="EVM2018"/> <!--{{Convert|0|m|ft|abbrev=on|sortable=on}} length m--> |[[Abkhazia]]<ref name = abhnote>{{Abkhazia-note}}</ref>/[[Georgia (country)|Georgia]] | style="text-align:center;"| <!--geology--> | <!--notes--> |-
| [[Krubera Cave|Krubera-Voronja Cave]] | style="text-align:center;"| 2197<ref>{{cite web |title=3D model of the Krubera (Voronja) Cave |publisher=Ukrainian Institute of Speleology and Karstology |url=http://www.network.speleogenesis.info/directory/exploration/krubera.php |format=VRML |accessdate=2009-04-04 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090401170048/http://www.network.speleogenesis.info/directory/exploration/krubera.php |archivedate=2009-04-01 |df= }}</ref><!--{{Convert|0|m|ft|abbrev=on|sortable=on}} depth m--> | style="text-align:center;"| 16,058<ref name="Speologilor">{{cite web|title=Great Caves of the World|url=http://www.speologie.org/caves|publisher=Portalul Speologilor din Romania|accessdate=10 May 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140512230814/http://www.speologie.org/caves|archivedate=12 May 2014|df=}}</ref><!--{{Convert|0|m|ft|abbrev=on|sortable=on}} length m--> |[[Abkhazia]]<ref name = abhnote/>/[[Georgia (country)|Georgia]] | style="text-align:center;"| <!--geology--> | <!--notes--> |-
| [[Sarma cave]] | style="text-align:center;"| 1830<ref name="RSEEA">{{cite web | editor-last = Endovitsky | editor-first = Alexey Vladimirovich | language = Russian | title = Отчет о спелеопоходе 4 к.с. по республике Абхазия (Западный Кавказ), совершенном с 29.08.2016 по 10.09.2016 г. | trans-title = Report on speleo expedition 4 c. c. (complexity category) in the Republic of Abkhazia (Western Caucasus), from August 29, 2016 to September 10, 2016 | date = 2016 | URL = http://berendei.tsu.ru/uploads/reports/ber_speleo_1_2013.pdf |access-date = 25 November 2018 }}</ref><!--{{Convert|0|m|ft|abbrev=on|sortable=on}} depth m--> | style="text-align:center;"| 19,000<ref name="RSEEA"/><!--{{Convert|0|m|ft|abbrev=on|sortable=on}} length m--> |[[Abkhazia]]<ref name = abhnote/>/[[Georgia (country)|Georgia]] | style="text-align:center;"| <!--geology--> | <!--notes--> |-
| [[Snezhnaja cave]] | style="text-align:center;"| 1760<ref name="SCA">{{cite web | last = Gromov | first = Alexey | language = Russian | title = Снежная пещера в Абхазии: фото, описание | trans-title = Snezhnaja (Snow) Cave in Abkhazia: Photos and Description | date = 27 December 2017 | URL = http://fb.ru/article/368238/snejnaya-peschera-v-abhazii-foto-opisanie |access-date = 25 November 2018 }}</ref> <!--{{Convert|0|m|ft|abbrev=on|sortable=on}} depth m--> | style="text-align:center;"| 32,000<ref name="SCA"/><!--{{Convert|0|m|ft|abbrev=on|sortable=on}} length m--> |[[Abkhazia]]<ref name = abhnote/>/[[Georgia (country)|Georgia]] | style="text-align:center;"| <!--geology--> | <!--notes--> |-
| [[Gouffre Mirolda cave|Gouffre Mirolda]] | style="text-align:center;"| 1733<ref name="Speologilor"/><!--{{Convert|0|m|ft|abbrev=on|sortable=on}} depth m--> | style="text-align:center;"| <!--{{Convert|0|m|ft|abbrev=on|sortable=on}} length m--> |[[France]] | style="text-align:center;"| <!--geology--> | <!--notes--> |-
| [[Vogelschacht and Lamprechtsofen cave|Vogelschacht and Lamprechtsofen]] | style="text-align:center;"| 1632<ref name="Speologilor"/><!--{{Convert|0|m|ft|abbrev=on|sortable=on}} depth m--> | style="text-align:center;"| <!--{{Convert|0|m|ft|abbrev=on|sortable=on}} length m--> |[[Austria]] | style="text-align:center;"| <!--geology--> | <!--notes--> |-
| [[Jean Bernard System]] | style="text-align:center;"| 1602<ref>{{cite book|title=Le gouffre Jean-Bernard, 1602 m: Samoens/Haute-Savoie/France : record du monde de profondeur|date=1991|publisher=Groupe Vulcain|isbn=9782741700319|url=https://www.amazon.com/gouffre-Jean-Bernard-1602-Haute-Savoie-profondeur/dp/2741700311}}</ref> <!--{{Convert|0|m|ft|abbrev=on|sortable=on}} depth m--> | style="text-align:center;"| <!--{{Convert|0|m|ft|abbrev=on|sortable=on}} length m--> |[[France]] | style="text-align:center;"| <!--geology--> | <!--notes--> |-
| [[Torca del Cerro del Cuevon cave|Torca del Cerro del Cuevón]] | style="text-align:center;"| 1589<ref name="Speologilor"/><!--{{Convert|0|m|ft|abbrev=on|sortable=on}} depth m--> | style="text-align:center;"| <!--{{Convert|0|m|ft|abbrev=on|sortable=on}} length m--> |[[Spain]] | style="text-align:center;"| <!--geology--> | <!--notes--> |-
| [[Wot-U-Got Pot - Hirlatzhöhle]] | style="text-align:center;"| 1560<ref name="Wot-U-Got Pot - Hirlatzhöhle">{{cite web|title=Lang gesuchter Durchstieg in der Hirlatzhöhle gefunden|url=https://www.kleinezeitung.at/oesterreich/oesterreichaufmacher/5505252/Dachstein_Lang-gesuchter-Durchstieg-in-der-Hirlatzhoehle-gefunden|publisher=Kleine Zeitung|date= September 30, 2018|accessdate=30 Sep 2018}}</ref> <!--{{Convert|0|m|ft|abbrev=on|sortable=on}} depth m--> | style="text-align:center;"| 112,929<ref name="Wot-U-Got Pot - Hirlatzhöhle"/><!--{{Convert|0|m|ft|abbrev=on|sortable=on}} length m--> |[[Austria]] | style="text-align:center;"| <!--geology--> | <!--notes--> |-
| [[Sistema Huautla]] | style="text-align:center;"| 1545<ref name="Sistema Huautla">{{cite web|title=Sistema Huautla Becomes Deepest Cave in the Western Hemisphere |url=http://cavingnews.com/20130403-sistema-huautla-becomes-deepest-cave-in-the-western-hemisphere |publisher=CavingNews |date=April 3, 2013 |accessdate=22 Jan 2015}}</ref><!--{{Convert|0|m|ft|abbrev=on|sortable=on}} depth m--> | style="text-align:center;"| 64,200<ref name="Sistema Huautla"/><!--{{Convert|0|m|ft|abbrev=on|sortable=on}} length m--> |[[Mexico]] | style="text-align:center;"| <!--geology--> | <!--notes--> |-

[[File:POL Gdańsk COA.svg|thumb|right|300px|Coat of arms of Gdańsk]] This article lists the '''mayors''' ({{lang-de|Bürgermeister}}) of '''Danzig''' ([[Gdańsk]]) from 1308 to 1945. For the list of mayors from 1945 to the present day, refer to [[List of mayors of Gdańsk]].
==Oberbürgermeister== *1224 – Gdańsk received [[city rights]] (with [[Lübeck law]]) *1308 – [[Teutonic takeover of Danzig (Gdańsk)]]
===[[Teutonic Order]]=== :''Note that dates overlap. This is because there were four mayors. First was titled ''president'' and had highest power, the rest were named ''second mayor'', ''third mayor'' and ''fourth mayor''. After a year the president gave power to the second mayor, and became the fourth mayor. The process repeated itself, interrupted by deaths and elections of new mayors.''
*1342–1347 – Dettloff von der Osten *1342–1354 – Henrich Burmeister der Ältere *1346–1355 – Steffen von der Osten *1354–1374 – Hillebrand Müntzer *1356–1360 – Johan von Stein *1359–1372 – Johann Wallrabe der Ältere *1361–1362 – Casper Bock *1362–1390 – Gottschalck Naase *1368–1387 – Paul Jann *1372–1385 – Johann Wallrabe der Jüngere *1379–1386 – Johann Wackaw *1381–1384 – Nicklaus Gottsknecht *1384–1392 – Herman Rolberg *1392–1405 – Reinhold Hittfeld *1395–1399 – Lubbert Haacke *1399–1404 – Peter Fürstenau *1402–1418 – Tideman Huxer *1405–1411 – [[Conrad Letzkau]] *1407–1410 – Peter Vorraht *1408–1411 – Arend or Arnold Hecht *1411–1417 – Herman Hittfeld *1412–1413 – Albrecht Dödorff *1413–1430 – Gert von der Becke *1415–1416 – Steffen Plötzker *(before 1436) – Nicklaus Rogge *1419–1433 – Johann Beisener *1430–1441 – Peter Holste *1433–1446 – Lucas Meckelfeld *1433–1443 – Heinrich Vorraht *1436–1449 – Meinert Cölmer *1442–1456 – Martin Cremon *1445–1456 – Albrecht Hexer *1447–1480 – Reinhold Niederhoff *1452–1462 – Herman Stargardt
===[[Kingdom of Poland (1385–1569)|Kingdom of Poland]]=== :''Teutonic Order lost Danzig to [[Poland]] after 1454, during the [[Thirteen Years' War (1454–66)|Thirteen Years' War]], and by the [[Second Peace of Thorn (1466)]]''
*1454–1461 – Wilhelm Jordan *1457–1461 – Jacob Falcke *1461–1475 – Johann von Scheren *1462–1478 – Johann von Walde *1462–1478 – Johann Veere *1470–1483 – Philipp Bischoff *1477–1483 – Johann Angermünde *1479–1501 – Johann Ferber *1483–1485 – Marten Bock *1484–1502 – George Buck *1484–1490 – Johann Schewecke *1489–1505 – Henrich Falcke *1492–1501 – Henrich von Süchten *1502–1513 – George Mand *1503–1512 – Johann Schewecke der Jüngere *1504–1513 – Matthias Zimmerman *1506–1507 – Antoni Backelman *1510–1526 – Eberhard Ferber *1513–1525 – Greger Brand *1514–1524 – Henrich Wiese *1517–1535 – Philipp Bischoff *1524–1529 – Matthias Lange *1525–1538 – Cordt von Süchten *1526–1535 – Edward Niederhoff *1526–1554 – Johann von Werden *1531–1547 – George Schewecke *1536–1539 – Peter Behme *1538–1549 – Barthell Brand *1540–1560 – Dr. Tiedemann Giese (nephew of the bishop [[Tiedemann Giese]]) *1550–1554 – Johann Stutte
===[[Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth]]=== :''Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth begun in 1569 with the [[Union of Lublin]], which declared [[personal union]] with the king ended (was not accepted)''
*1548–1577 – [[Johann Brandes]] *1555–1588 – Constantin Feber *1557–1578 – Johann Proite *1558–1576 – [[Georg Kleefeld]] *1577–1585 – Reinhold Möllner *1578–1592 – Georg Rosenberg *1581–1619 – Johann von der Linde *1586–1602 – Daniel Zierenberg *1589–1605 – Constantin Giese *1592–1612 – Gerhard Brandes *1603–1611 – Johann Thorbecke *1605–1614 – Barthell Schachtmann *1612–1616 – Andreas Borkman *1612–1625 – Johann Speymann *1615–1617 – Barthell Brandt *1617–1629 – Arnold von Holten *1618–1636 – Eggert von Kempen *1619–1635 – Valentin von Bodeck *1626–1620 – Ernst Kroll *1630–1642 – Johann Zierenberg *1630–1631 – [[Adrian von der Linde]] *1632–1654 – Constantin Ferber *1636–1644 – Hans Rogge *1637–1639 – Johann Ernst Schröder *1640–1649 – Nicklas Pahl *1643–1644 – Elert von Bobart *1645–1646 – Daniel Falcke *1645–1682 – [[Adrian von der Linde]] *1647–1654 – Henrich Freder *1650–1665 – Friederich Ehler *1655–1663 – Nathanaël Schmieden *1655–1673 – George von Bömelen *1664–1675 – Nicklas von Bodeck *1666–1685 – Gabriel Krumhausen *1677–1701 – Christian Schröder *1677–1686 – Daniel Proite *1683–1700 – Barbiel Schuhmann *1686–1704 – Constantin Ferber *1687–1691 – Constantin Ferber *1692–1707 – Johann Ernst Schmieden *1700–1707 – Constantin Ferber *1702–1707 – Reinhold Wieder *1704–1722 – Andreas Borkman *1707–1716 – Friedrich Gottlieb Engelcke *1708–1712 – Joachim Hoyge *1708–1740 – Gabriel von Bömeln *1712–1721 – Ernst von der Linde *1716–1710 – Carl Ernst Bauer *1720–1745 – Johann Gottfried von Disseldorff *1722–1720 – Salomon Gabriel Schumann *1723–1734 – Gottfried von Bentzmann *1730–1739 – Carl Groddeck *1735–1757 – Johann Wahl *1740–1753 – Carl Gottlieb Ehler *1741–1746 – Joachim Jacob Schwacher *1746–1748 – Johann Carl Schwartzwald *1746–1755 – Nathanael Gottfried Ferber *1750–1753 – Fridrich Krüger *1754 – Christian Gabriel von Schröder *1754 – Michael Schmidt *1756 – Johann Kenner *? – Johann Ernst von der Linde *1762–1776 – Gottlieb G. Weickhmann *1763–1767 – [[Daniel Gralath]] *1777 – Gottfried Schwartz *1787 – Johann von Bentzmann *1790 – Zernecke *1793 – Eduard Friedrich von Conradi
===[[Kingdom of Prussia]]=== *1794 – von Lindenow
===[[Free City of Danzig (Napoleonic)]]=== *1807–1808 – Carl Friedrich von Gralath *1808–1810 – [[Gottlieb Hufeland]] *1810–1814 – Johann Willhelm Wernsdorff *1814–1849 – Joachim Heinrich von Weickhmann
===Kingdom of Prussia and [[German Empire]]=== *1850–1862 – Carl August von Groddeck *1863–1891 – Leopold von Winter *1891–1896 – Dr. Karl Adolf Baumbach *1896–1902 – Dr. [[Clemens von Delbrück]] *1903–1910 – Heinrich Otto Ehlers *1910–1919 – Heinrich Heinrich Scholtz
===[[Free City of Danzig]]=== :''Free City of Danzig created by the [[Treaty of Versailles]]''
*1920–1931 – Dr. [[Heinrich Sahm]] (since 1920 President of Senate) *1931–1933 – [[Ernst Ziehm]] (President of Senate) *1933–1934 – [[Hermann Rauschning]] (President of Senate) *1934–1939 – [[Arthur Greiser]] (President of Senate)
===[[World War II]]=== :''Free City occupied by [[Nazi Germany]] and incorporated into the [[Reichsgau Danzig-West Prussia]]''
*1939–1945 – {{ill|Georg Lippke|de}}
===[[Poland]]=== :''Danzig conquered by [[Soviet Union]] in 1945 (see [[East Pomeranian Offensive]]) and returned to Poland, as Gdańsk after the end of the World War II (see [[Territorial changes of Poland immediately after World War II]] and [[Former eastern territories of Germany]] for details)''
==See also== *[[List of mayors of Gdańsk]] (1945–present) *[[History of Gdańsk]] **[[Timeline of Gdańsk]]
==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20071110222029/http://roots.gdansk.pl/en/postacie/burmistrzowie.php List at roots.gdansk.pl]

== Casualties breakdown == [a].{{note|a}}[[North African Campaign]] (WWII) – combined figure ~430,000 killed: :[[Western Desert Campaign]] – 50,000 casualties. :[[Battle of Cape Bon (1941)|Battle of Cape Bon]] – 900+ casualties. :[[Raid on Alexandria (1941)]] – 8 casualties. :[[Action off Cape Bougaroun]] – 27 killed. :[[Attack on Mers-el-Kébir|Mers al-Kbir]] – 1,299 killed. :[[Operation Torch]] – 1,825 killed. :[[Tunisia campaign]] – ~376,000 killed.
[b].{{note|b}}[[Western Sahara conflict|Polisario Front dispute for independence]] (combined casualty figure 14,020–14,038): :[[Western Sahara War]] – 7,000 Moroccan, Mauritianian and French soldiers killed; 4,000 Polisario killed; 3,000 civilians killed. :[[Independence Intifada (Western Sahara)]] – 1 killed. :[[Gdeim Izik protest camp]] – 18–36 killed. :[[2011 Western Saharan protests|2011 Sahrawi protests]] – 1 killed.
[c].{{note|c}}Tuareg rebellion (1990–1995) combined casualties at least 650-1,500: :[[Tchin-Tabaradene massacre]] – 650-1,500 civilians killed.
[d].{{note|d}}[[Egyptian Crisis]] combined casualty figure 4,686-4,687: :[[2011 Egyptian Revolution]] – 846 killed :[[Timeline of the Egyptian Crisis under the Supreme Council of the Armed Forces|Aftermath of the Egyptian Revolution]] – 300 killed :[[Timeline of the Egyptian Crisis under Mohamed Morsi]] 127-128 killed :[[Post-coup unrest in Egypt (2013–2014)]] 3143 killed :[[Insurgency in Egypt (2013–present)]] 570 killed
[e].{{note|e}}[[Libyan Crisis]] combined casualty figure 40,000+: :[[2011 Libyan civil war]] – 25,000–30,000 killed :[[Post-civil war violence in Libya]] – Over 1000 killed :[[Libyan Civil War (2014–present)]] - thousands killed
==See also== *[[List of conflicts in Africa]] *[[List of modern conflicts in the Middle East]] {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2011}}
